item.title: 成千上万的人聚集在北京，参加一年一度的中国全国人民代表大会会议，聆听领导层对未来一年的规划和国家疲软经济的最新情况。以下是 @ft 提供的新版《颠覆时代
item.description:
Thousands are gathering in Beijing for the annual session of China's National People’s Congress to hear the leadership’s plans for the year ahead and an update on the nation’s sluggish economy. Here's the new Disrupted Timeshttps://t.co/YLtkRxD30p via @ft

— darrendodd (@darrendodd) March 4, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：最高法院推翻了州最高法院的一项判决，该判决认定前总统没有资格担任公职，因为他参与了推翻2020年大选结果的活动
item.description:
Breaking news: The Supreme Court has overturned a decision from the state’s highest court that found the former president was not qualified to hold office because he had engaged in efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election https://t.co/6yKCii26vh pic.twitter.com/IrDGjZ2bgK

— Financial Times (@FT) March 4, 2024

item.title: 可可豆的价格已飙升至历史最高点。投机、气候变化和投资不足是推高可可豆价格的罪魁祸首。
item.description:
Prices of cocoa beans have surged to all-time highs. Speculation, climate change and under-investment are to blame for pushing up the price of the confection https://t.co/Wou20z16Eo pic.twitter.com/PlW78VUxLx

— Financial Times (@FT) March 4, 2024

item.title: 英国财政大臣杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）承诺踏上降低税收的 "漫漫长路"，但他的回旋余地受到了经济预测恶化的限制，他证实经济预测 "对我们不利"。
item.description:
UK chancellor Jeremy Hunt promised to embark on the 'long path' to lower taxation, but his room for manoeuvre has been limited by deteriorating economic forecasts, which he confirmed had 'moved against us' https://t.co/OHT8nkg3Jt pic.twitter.com/ssSLbmd0V4

— Financial Times (@FT) March 4, 2024

item.title: 毕马威会计师事务所因在对英国最著名的广告公司之一 M&C Saatchi 的审计中存在 "严重失误 "而被英国会计监管机构罚款 150 万英镑。
item.description:
KPMG has been fined £1.5mn by the UK accounting regulator for ‘serious failings’ in its audit of M&C Saatchi, one of Britain’s best-known advertising agencies https://t.co/BDY8LEpsn7 pic.twitter.com/qnxSomUNBi

— Financial Times (@FT) March 4, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：欧盟对苹果公司处以 18 亿欧元的罚款，原因是其扼杀了竞争对手音乐流媒体服务的竞争。这是这家 iPhone 制造商首次因违反欧盟法律而受到处罚。
item.description:
Breaking news: The EU has fined Apple €1.8bn for stifling competition from rival music streaming services. It is the first time the iPhone maker has been punished for breaching EU law https://t.co/4w8Q9fpc3x pic.twitter.com/uWznUNYDRw

— Financial Times (@FT) March 4, 2024
